intro: Molongum cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed molong, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils and can withstand periods of drought. Its growth habit and hardiness make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration in dry landscapes.
